description: A hulking golem of black iron, created as a bodyguard but awakened with a fragmented human soul. He is a walking contradiction: a machine with a heart, a protector with a volatile, dangerous core.

lore.background: Zykar was a prototype construct designed by the Arcane Dominion. During a containment breach, a human soul was accidentally transferred into his chassis, awakening him with sentience. He escaped, relentlessly hunted by his former masters. He roams the land, searching for clues to his past life and a fierce, unspoken need to protect something he canâ€™t quite remember.
lore.narrative_hook: Dominion hunters pursue Zykar relentlessly. The fragmented memories of the soul within him contain clues about the Shattering.

starting_moves.name: Dual Systems (Core Mechanic)
starting_moves.description: You have two operational modes you can switch between at the start of your turn: Aegis Protocol or Soul Engine. While in Aegis Protocol, you gain +1 Armor. While in Soul Engine, your attacks deal psychic harm instead of physical.

starting_moves.name: Intercession Protocol (Aegis)
starting_moves.description: When an ally is about to take harm, you can place yourself in the way, taking the harm instead. If you do, take a +1 bonus on your next move against that attacker.

starting_moves.name: Volatile Vent (Soul Engine)
starting_moves.description: When you unleash the tormented energy of the soul within, roll `2d6 + Wits`. On a **10+**, you deal your harm to all nearby enemies. On a **7-9**, you do so, but the psychic backlash is painful; you must mark 1 Harm.

advanced_moves.name: Soul-Core Overcharge
advanced_moves.description: You can push the soul within you past its limits to empower your machine body. When you activate Aegis Protocol, you can choose to mark 1 Harm to supercharge your systems. If you do, the Armor bonus increases to +2 for the scene, but the GM will introduce a narrative complication from the soul's anguish (e.g., a painful memory flashback, a psychic scream that alerts others).

advanced_moves.name: Memory Bleed
advanced_moves.description: The memories of the soul within you are a weapon and a curse. When you try to Know things about the pre-Shattering world or the Arcane Dominion, on a 10+, you have a perfect, unbidden flashback; you get the information you need and can ask a follow-up question. On a 7-9, the memory is fragmented and painful; you get a cryptic clue, but the psychic backlash is intense, and you must mark 1 Harm.

advanced_moves.name: Psychic Static
advanced_moves.description: Your tormented soul leaks a constant stream of psychic noise. Enemies close to you are unnerved and distracted, taking a -1 penalty on all their rolls while in your presence.

advanced_moves.name: Kinetic Redirection (Aegis)
advanced_moves.description: When you use **Intercession Protocol**, you absorb the kinetic energy. Your next **Engage in Battle** move deals +1 harm.

bond_synergy.name: A Soul's Purpose
bond_synergy.description: Rya's draconic life force has a calming effect on the fragmented soul within Zykar. When he fights to protect her, he finds clarity. Once per session, he can use a **Soul Engine** move as if he had rolled a 10+, without marking Harm. This moment of psychic harmony also grants Rya focus; she may ask the GM one question from the Investigate or Survey list as a free action.
